result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard M Ott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard M Ott appeared by video.  Attorney Kirk D Henley appeared by video for Richard M Ott.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final Pretrial held. Court holds colloquy with parties.  Case remains in trial posture.  
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 30.

Defendant Richard M Ott appeared by phone.  Attorney Kirk D Henley appeared by video for Richard M Ott.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea and sentencing. Defense requests to resolve the case through a jury trial. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard M Ott in court with attorney Kirk D Henley.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Monica Shawna Dixon appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned for in-person hearing, Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Case rescheduled off the record due to judge unavailability.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard M Ott in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard M Ott appeared by video means.
Case in court for status. Defendant advises the court he is having issues with discovery. Court asks defendant if he wants counsel appointed. Defendant accepts.  
Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court. Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Kirk Henly to represent defendant at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 Per Month. Repayment to begin08/01/2022 and on the first of every month thereafter until paid in full. 
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment. Court ordered matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. 
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard M Ott in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard M Ott appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant appears in court pro se.   Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard M Ott in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard M Ott
Current: 2211 South 111th Street #6, West Allis, WI 53227   (Effective: 03-29-2022)
Prior: 2211 South 111th Street, West Allis, WI 53227
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22  @ 1p
